member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Environment.CommandBarButton.IsEnabled
member.summary: Returns true if the button is currently enabled, taking both the DefaultEnabled property and the UpdateCommandUI event into account. If any event handler for UpdateCommandUI sets its Enabled property, then that value is returned, otherwise DefaultEnabled is returned.
member.remarks: This property reflects the behavior of the RobotStudio UI; if a button is enabled in a menu or the ribbon, then this property will return true.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Environment.CommandBarButton.IsChecked
member.summary: Returns true if the button is currently checked, taking both the DefaultChecked property and the UpdateCommandUI event into account. If any event handler for UpdateCommandUI sets its Checked property, then that value is returned, otherwise DefaultEnabled is returned.
member.remarks: This property reflects the behavior of the RobotStudio UI; if a button is checked in a menu or the ribbon, then this property will return true.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Environment.CommandBarButton.Enabled

member.summary: This property is obsolete. Use instead, or to get the current state. This property may be removed in future versions.

member.name: P:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Environment.CommandBarButtonGroup.HandleButtons
member.summary: Specifies how CommandBarButton objects in the group are handled. If false, the button's UpdateCommandUI event is raised when the group is displayed, and the button's ExecuteCommand event is raised when the button is clicked. If true, the button's state is decided when it is added, and the groups ExecuteCommand event is raised when the button is clicked.

member.name: T:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Environment.CommandBarControl
member.summary: Base class for all items appearing in tool bars, menus and context menus.
member.remarks:
Most classes inheriting from CommandBarControl takes an ID argument in their constructors. Each instance of a CommandBarControl which is added to the UIEnvironment must have a unique ID. The Id is used to identify the control in for example the event handler. CommandBarControls with a unique ID and has been added to a control collection, can be found using . In order to avoid collisions between Id strings used by Add-Ins, its is recomended that the name of the Add-In is used as a prefix. For example "MyCompany.MyAddin.LaunchSetupDialog", instead of using only "LaunchSetupDialog" as the Id.
The same CommandBarControl can be added to multiple collections, in order to display the same menu/toolbar choice in multiple places.

member.summary: Gets or sets if this CommandBarControl represents an undoable command.
member.remarks: This property is used to avoid unintended nesting of undoable operations. If it is True, the command will be disabled while any other undoable operation is in progress.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Environment.CommandBarPopup.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a CommandBarPopup with a specific ID.
member.remarks:
The ID will be set as the popup's caption as well.
Prefix the ID with the name of your Add-In, to avoid conflicts.

member.name: M:ABB.Robotics.RobotStudio.Environment.CommandBarPopup.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a CommandBarPopup with a specific ID and caption.
member.remarks:
The ID can be null, which creates a popup that will not be added to the UIEnvironment.CommandBarControls collection.
If you specify an ID, prefix it with the name of your Add-In, to avoid conflicts.
